title: Superlatives
description: Superlatives are used to show the highest or lowest degree of a quality in a group. They help us say which thing or person is the most or least.

subtopics.title: Short Adjectives
subtopics.description: Add -est to short adjectives to make the superlative form.

examples.explanation: Add -est to adjectives with one syllable
examples.sample: He is the tallest in the class.

subtopics.title: Adjectives Ending in -y
subtopics.description: Change -y to -i and add -est for adjectives ending in -y.

examples.sample: He is the happiest boy here.
She is the busiest person I know.

subtopics.title: Long Adjectives
subtopics.description: Use 'the most' before adjectives with two or more syllables.

examples.sample: This is the most beautiful park.
It is the most expensive phone.
This is the most interesting story.

subtopics.title: Using 'the' with Superlatives
subtopics.description: Always use 'the' before a superlative adjective.

examples.sample: She is the most careful driver.

exercises.instruction: Complete: 'He is the ___ (young) in the team.'
exercises.sentence: He is the ___ in the team.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using a superlative: 'This car is fast. That car is faster. My car is the fastest.'
exercises.sentence: This car is fast. That car is faster. My car is the fastest.
